screen.title: Launchpad overview
screen.headline: Collaboration and project hosting for free software projects

summary.p: Collaboration is crucial to free software projects. Traditionally, it has been difficult for communities to exchange information if they use different tools.

Throughout this tour, you'll see how Launchpad's new approach solves the problems of collaboration on software projects. By bringing together information from different project-specific sources and helping communities to organise themselves into teams, Launchpad helps different projects to collaborate on common problems, such as bugs in shared code.
Let's start by finding our way around the interface.

screen.callout: You can always see which project you're currently working on in the top-left of the page.
Use the tabs to switch between Launchpad's applications.
The Actions menu is important in Launchpad, giving you access to the main functionality of the current application.
You can find additional information in the expandable boxes below the Actions menu.

screen.title: People
screen.summary: Launchpad makes it easy to find out what work someone is involved in. Each individual's home page shows their team memberships, the projects that they're most active in and their contact details.
screen.callout: Knowing who you're working with is an important part of community building and may help you find people to collaborate with.
Launchpad shows you which projects and applications each person has used most recently.
You can build a picture of someone's interests by seeing which Launchpad teams they've joined.
Launchpad shows you how to contact people that you'd like to work with and where to find a wiki page with more information.

screen.title: Teams
screen.headline: Effortless team creation

summary.p: Strong communities are built on teams. Launchpad helps communities to develop rich structures, through the effortless creation of teams around projects and initiatives.
Teams work just like individuals: they can join other teams and take roles in projects, such as acting as a bug supervisor for a project.

screen.callout: Your team's description is an important way to let potential members know your plans and how they can join you.

As a team administrator, you choose the membership policy that's most appropriate: open: anyone can join; moderated: anyone can apply to join but a team administrator must approve their membership; restricted: a team administrator must invite a person to join.
This row of small icons shows which other teams this team has joined.

summary.p: Registering your project with Launchpad is the first step to improving your collaboration. It's free, quick and easy.
Once you've told Launchpad about your project, you're ready to start using each of its five tools.
